attributes.content: Take a count of the dead and wounded.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: It’s just as you said. They used us as bait, and a battle ensued.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Are you disappointed, Talulah?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: —No.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They had their reasons for doing this, and I also know exactly what they were. Knowing they had a legitimate reason, I couldn’t possibly have gotten my hopes up.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...The informant must be executed.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: And how should we pick out this traitor, out of all the people that wanted to flee the battlefield?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They betrayed their brothers-in-arms for a moment of peace. If you make excuses for them, you’re only putting your warriors in harm’s way.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: No. They never swore their loyalty to us in the first place.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You want every last person on your team to be absolutely perfect? That’s impossible. You won’t find a squad like that anywhere.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But the guerrillas—
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: The guerrilla fighters aren’t perfect either.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: There are only a handful of people as perfect as you're making them out to be. Everyone else has their own reasons to be here, and only because they are willing to pay the price, but that doesn't mean they've thought it all through.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Stand down, soldier. Don’t try to argue with her.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: It takes a lot more work to build a city than to destroy one, Mister. Just let them stay.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If there’s more than one way for the Infected to survive, I’d rather see all of those ways work out.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah, you can’t always try to go about everything without making sacrifices.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Sacrifices...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Is that even up to me to decide?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: All of us are prepared for the worst. You can’t win without spilling blood.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Heading south will lead to war. I know it, and I am sure you know it too.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: The Empire isn’t going to sit by and watch the Infected unite and grow into a major force. If everything goes the way you pitched it and the Infected actually manage to take their fate into their own hands, then this war is inevitable.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: —You’re right.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We need to first let the Infected understand that their lives have meaning.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They don’t have an obligation to face anything that comes after that.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You want the guerrillas to fight this war?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Talulah, are you waiting for a war to break out between Ursus and another country, one that you can profit from...?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Or are you trying to sow the seeds of that war yourself?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: (Silence)
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You don’t want to give me an answer.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: You should know that any victory you can hope to achieve will bring with it disastrous results.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: You’re probably right.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But that doesn’t mean I’m going to sacrifice any lives.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Are you prepared to bear the tremendous pain to come?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Not at all. Things are bound to be painful, after all.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Do you expect everyone to be so kind-hearted?
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: I simply have faith that the people of Ursus weren’t born selfish and cruel.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Perhaps you’ll come face to face with real evil one day.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: I’ve already crossed paths with my old friend a few times.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I sure hope so.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: If a soldier swears loyalty to his fellow men only to later betray them for his own profit, I will personally write up his charges.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But if the group of Infected we are dealing with aren’t fighting for the same cause as us, what gives us the right to annihilate them? It doesn’t make them our enemies.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah!
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Ngh...!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Please, go on.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: There are a lot of people whom I respected. Not for their strength, but for their honesty.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: —I can only hope you are one of them.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: ...I will keep that in mind.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Petrova, where’s FrostNova at right now?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...She’s still at the mountain pass. She said she’s holding the fort there until we finish capturing the city.
attributes.name: Petrova

attributes.content: Let’s rendezvous with them. I need to apologize to her personally.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So... Is that it, Captain?
attributes.name: Shieldguard

attributes.content: There should still be at least three garrisons around. We need to take down every last one of them before we can get the supplies out.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: All things considered, she made the right decision. The nomadic city doesn’t have that much longer of a walk ahead of it.
attributes.name: Patriot

attributes.content: Oh, Talulah!
attributes.name: Eno

attributes.content: Are you in a bad mood, Talulah?
attributes.name: Eno

attributes.content: Nope, I’m fine.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Eno, Sasha.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Do you still want me to use your real names?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Why do you ask?
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: It’s better to have a name that we can use to protect ourselves when we are so far away from home.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Sometimes, if we don’t pick a name for ourselves, we will only ever be called the names others give us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But you haven’t ever given yourself another name.
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: That’s only because I don’t want to.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Why? You were just saying we should use different names.
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: Because... I want to be the same person both inside and out. I want to become someone whose actions represent her beliefs.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So then your current actions are different from your words.
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: Sasha!
attributes.name: Eno

attributes.content: You’re right. That’s very likely.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That’s why I insist on using my name. It’s just that the name doesn’t really have much meaning to everyone else.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: After all, who I am isn’t important to any of them. My name is only important to myself.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So what should I call you, then? When you put it like this, I’m not sure what I’m supposed to call you.
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: Sasha, how about I put it this way, then?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I’m just a rebel, just a normal person.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: My name? That’s not important. No one should remember my name. This name shouldn’t become a symbol, and it shouldn’t come to have any other kind of power. It’s just my name, and it’s nothing more than a name.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: If you want to call me by a name, you can just call me Talulah for now. When you call me by my name, I’ll turn around and look back, but that’s all there is to it.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah.
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: You can call me Talulah too, Eno.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It may be a little too early to tell you two this... but I want to, Sasha.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Go on.
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: I want you call me Talulah because I want you to think of me as a friend. Good friends like we’re all peas in a pod.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Even if I die, you will still remember my name, but not because I did anything special during my lifetime.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I just want you to remember the time we spent together. I want you to remember you once had a friend called Talulah.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But you’re killing bad guys. You’re fighting them.
attributes.name: Sasha

attributes.content: The girl who fights shouldn’t have a name. Everyone has their own fight. We are all fighters.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Don’t hang your head and just follow in the fighters’ footsteps. Don’t do that!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Not everyone is like Patriot. All of us make mistakes. Look ahead of you, and look at where he’s going. You don’t just keep your eyes shut and follow whoever that has the more important-sounding title.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The names you remember are your friends’ names. The names of the people you spend the most time with.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It’s FrostNova who gave you that extra spicy candy but still gritted her teeth and smiled. It’s your teacher, who made you that weird vegetable stew. It’s Patriot, who will never give up on training you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They are all your friends, not fighters.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: As fighters, we don’t have names.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...Talulah, I don’t get it.
attributes.name: Eno

attributes.content: Well... I want you to trust me because I’m your friend, not because of my position.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Just like all my other friends.
attributes.name: Talulah
